page.title: 07Housing Denchworth W.Grove
page.content: Most houses in Denchworth are well established. The oldest, Magpie Cottage, was destroyed by fire in 1984 but is being rebuilt to its original specification of wattle and daub with wooden frame. The village is Cruciform and is on clay. All the old business premises are now converted to houses. The houses date from 16th century, the last few being added from 1950 on. Most villagers have moved in from other areas. Housing is expensive from Â£60.000. W. Grove, built on a 1939 to 1945 airfield, comprises assorted kinds of houses. Terraced Â£30 to Â£40,000, semi-detached Â£35-45,000 and detached houses Â£45-59,000. Young families own these compact properties with small gardens. A very few council houses and flats are available.There is a residential caravan park.
